alert.note: Alert for Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:01PM CDT until July 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR HENRY...VAN BUREN...NORTHWESTERN LOUISA...SOUTHEASTERN KEOKUK... WASHINGTON...JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN LEE...SCOTLAND AND WESTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 959 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Noble to Birmingham to 7 miles northeast of Lancaster, moving south at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 10 PM, 55 to 58 mph were reported from Ottumwa Airport, through Fairfield Iowa Airport. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fairfield, Mount Pleasant, Washington, Kahoka, Memphis, Keosauqua, New London, Winfield, West Point, Wayland, Donnellson, Brighton, Richland, Ainsworth, Batavia, Birmingham, Milton, Bonaparte, Salem and Libertyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
